bug.author: jackalcooper
bug.summary: how to use interactive_graphviz for xla?
bug.description:
in <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/xla/jit#tutorial>xla doc</denchmark-link> it suggest that
/tmp/foo will contain the HLO before and after optimizations for each HLO module that's run. You can read this as-is, or you can visualize it using tensorflow/compiler/xla/tools:interactive_graphviz.
but I cannot locate this binary.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jackalcooper>@jackalcooper</denchmark-link> Can you provide more details about the issue?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gadagashwini>@gadagashwini</denchmark-link> in the TensorFlow 1.14 release note, it mentioned that:
XLA XLA HLO graphs can be inspected with interactive_graphviz tool now.
but I couldn't find how to use it.

This is not Build/Installation or Bug/Performance issue. Please post this kind of support questions at <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow>Stackoverflow</denchmark-link> . There is a big community to support and learn from your questions. GitHub is mainly for addressing bugs in installation and performance. Thanks!
